intro: Cephaelis ivorensis, commonly known as the Ivory Coast celandine, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and opposite leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
